adjectives.description: apocryphal (comparative more apocryphal, superlative most apocryphal)

entries.meaning: (Christianity) Of, or pertaining to, the Apocrypha.
(by extension) Of doubtful authenticity, or lacking authority; not regarded as canonical. [from 1590s]
examples: Many scholars consider the stories of the monk Teilo to be apocryphal.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Of dubious veracity; of questionable accuracy or truthfulness; anecdotal or in the nature of an urban legend.
examples: There is an apocryphal tale of a little boy plugging the dike with his finger.
